{{Quote|Why must evil always be so fleet of foot, while good loiters behind, holding back like an embarrassed younger brother? I pray that the gods may someday grant us swifter heroes!|}}
document_data.Relationships: She had a husband who worked as a farmer.
document_data.History:
Vivienne's life was adversely affected by the [[iron crisis]] that plagued the Sword Coast in the {{YearlinkName|1368}}. When her husband was riding his [[horse]]-drawn plow, the [[iron]] deteriorated and he was crushed beneath the plow and dragged along for {{SI|20|yd}} by the panicked beasts. He remained in a state that was incurable by the [[priest]]s of [[Baldur's Gate]], and Vivienne's life was left in ruin.

She traveled to the [[Blushing Mermaid]] inn, seeking adventurers or anyone that would help end the calamity that befell the land she called home.
